election_record.label: Massachusetts 1814 Governor

overview.note: There was considerable controversy over whether those citizens living on plantations in what is now the state of Maine should be allowed to vote in state elections. They did not pay taxes and many thought they should thus not be allowed to vote. Beginning in 1814, in many of the plantations, the votes were cast and counted and included separately in the Original Election Returns, with their totals not included among the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Alford
sub_unit.note: The votes from Alford were rejected.
The Boston Patriot lists Caleb Strong with 53 votes and Samuel Dexter with 37 votes.

"Rejected Votes. We some weeks since, procured the following statement of rejected votes, which had been given for Governor in Massachusetts the present year, with the causes of their rejection .... Alford, Berkshire, No qualification of the voters mentioned in the returns." The Pittsfield Sun (Pittsfield, MA). July 14, 1814.

sub_unit.name: Freetown
sub_unit.note: "Rejected for informality." Original Election Returns.

"Rejected Votes. We some weeks since, procured the following statement of rejected votes, which had been given for Governor in Massachusetts the present year, with the causes of their rejection .... Freetown, Bristol, Whole number of votes not returned, neither sorted, nor counted, nor declaration made." The Pittsfield Sun (Pittsfield, MA). July 14, 1814.

sub_unit.name: Westport
sub_unit.note: "Returned too late." Original Election Returns.

"Rejected Votes. We some weeks since, procured the following statement of rejected votes, which had been given for Governor in Massachusetts the present year, with the causes of their rejection .... Westport, Bristol, Received at Secretary's Office May 25th - too late." The Pittsfield Sun (Pittsfield, MA). July 14, 1814.

sub_unit.name: Thompson's Pond
sub_unit.note: Thompson's Pond was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Cummington
sub_unit.note: The votes from Cummington were not included in the Original Election Returns.
"No return." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Goose Pond/Swan Plantation
sub_unit.note: Goose Pond or Swan was a plantation whose votes were neither counted or listed in the Original Election Returns but was reported in the Eastern Argus April 14, 1814.

sub_unit.name: 25 Mile Pond
sub_unit.note: 25 Mile Pond was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Wales
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Wales.

sub_unit.name: Middlesex
sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 4 votes as J. B. Varnum.

sub_unit.name: Stow
sub_unit.note: The votes from Stow were not included in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Tewksbury
sub_unit.note: The votes from Tewksbury were not included in the Original Election Returns.
The Boston Patriot lists Samuel Dexter with 102 votes.

"Rejected Votes. We some weeks since, procured the following statement of rejected votes, which had been given for Governor in Massachusetts the present year, with the causes of their rejection .... Tewksbury, Middlesex, Not attested by the Town Clerk." The Pittsfield Sun (Pittsfield, MA). July 14, 1814.

sub_unit.name: Watertown
sub_unit.note: Joseph Story received 1 vote as J. Story.

sub_unit.name: Wilmington
sub_unit.note: The votes from Wilmington were not included in the Original Election Returns.

"Rejected Votes. We some weeks since, procured the following statement of rejected votes, which had been given for Governor in Massachusetts the present year, with the causes of their rejection .... Wilmington, Middlesex, Not attested by the Town Clerk." The Pittsfield Sun (Pittsfield, MA). July 14, 1814.
